boat.name: Emanuel

owners.note: Robert and Jan Holden have had care of Emanuel since February 1980.  The following 8 years were spent in a thorough rebuild, at Sandwich Sailing and Motor Boat Club, returning Emanuel to the water in July 1988.  We are by far the longest owners (we consider ourselves custodians) of the 15 registered on the British Register of Ships - Official Number 111396 at Bridgwater.
owners.text: Robert and Jan Holden have had care of Emanuel since February

boat.full_description: Emanuel has a well-documented history, dating back to 1928, apart from the period 1937 - 1980. Her current owners have undertaken a major restoration and researched her history, available for browsing on the boat's website.
boat.construction_details: Carvel pitch pine and larch on oak
boat.short_description: Emanuel was designed and built by Andrew Anderson & Son at Penarth, South Wales. She undertook the first recorded single-handed passage to Newfoundland by the Northern Route in 1934.  She returned via Bermuda suffering dreadful storms soon after leaving St Johns.
